column4: Sorry to be annoying... Is there any way to remove the selection sort of shading of mounted folders? Anyone knows?
i just did  "sudo mount  folder_1  folder_2"
didn't you say something about remote?
I did more experiments and found that it actually happens when one makes softlinks of folders as well
http://imagebin.org/123109    one is a soft link to the other  -- no "shading" here
see http://imagebin.org/123110 , I have the shading ...
ah, you are in a terminal?
yes, I am in a terminal
by default ls uses colors to distinguish file types
man ls will tell you how to change that
I agree that it makes sense to distinguish folder types this way, I was hoping there is a way to turn this off, looks really annoying to me when I have lots of sub-folders under a folder
, thanks, i was hoping to only turn off the shading, not all the coloring .. but thanks for your help any way
I'm certain that you can with dircolors
I'm certain that you can change it with dircolors
glad you worked it out :-)  congrats
